items.title: EBU/BBC study: 45% of responses from top AI assistants misrepresented news content with at least one significant issue and 31% showed serious sourcing problems (Olivia Le Poidevin/Reuters)
bullets: EBU/BBC study: 45% of AI responses misrepresent news.
31% of responses have serious sourcing issues.
AI assistants make widespread errors reporting news.
items.why_it_matters: This study reveals significant flaws in how AI assistants handle news, potentially eroding public trust in AI-generated information and media reporting.

items.title: Electricity demand from data centers powering the AI boom has caused a gas turbine supply crunch, as the US becomes the epicenter of new gas-fired power plants (Financial Times)
bullets: AI data centers cause massive electricity demand.
Leading to a shortage of gas turbines.
US is a hub for new gas-fired power plants.
items.why_it_matters: The rapid growth of AI is straining energy infrastructure, increasing reliance on fossil fuels and posing environmental and geopolitical challenges.

items.title: Keycard, which lets enterprises manage AI agent access to internal systems, raised a $30M Series A led by Acrew Capital and a $8M seed led by a16z and boldstart (Maria Deutscher/SiliconANGLE)
bullets: Keycard secured $38M in funding.
Includes $30M Series A and $8M seed rounds.
Helps enterprises manage AI agent access securely.
items.why_it_matters: As AI agents become critical business tools, securing their access is paramount. Keycard's funding highlights growing investment in AI security solutions.

items.title: Non-profit Cyber Monitoring Centre estimates that the Jaguar Land Rover cyberattack cost the UK economy at least £1.9B and affected over 5,000 UK organizations (Financial Times)
bullets: JLR cyberattack cost UK economy £1.9B+.
Over 5,000 UK organizations were impacted.
Considered UK's 'most economically damaging' cyber event.
items.why_it_matters: This incident underscores the massive economic and widespread impact that cyberattacks can have on national economies and interconnected supply chains.

items.title: Sources: Fal.ai, which hosts multimodal AI models for developers, raised ~$250M at a $4B+ valuation, less than three months after announcing a $125M Series C (Marina Temkin/TechCrunch)
bullets: Fal.ai raises ~$250M at $4B+ valuation.
New funding follows $125M Series C just 3 months prior.
Hosts multimodal AI models for developers.
items.why_it_matters: Fal.ai's rapid, substantial funding signals immense investor confidence and growing demand for platforms that simplify access to advanced multimodal AI for developers.

items.title: Hyro, whose AI agents let US health care organizations automate tasks like scheduling and prescription renewals, raised $45M, taking its total funding to $95M (Sophie Shulman/CTech)
bullets: Hyro secures $45M, total funding now $95M.
AI agents automate healthcare tasks.
Helps with scheduling and prescription renewals.
items.why_it_matters: Hyro's funding shows significant investment in AI for healthcare, aiming to reduce staff workload and improve patient access through automation.

items.title: Sesame, which is developing an AI agent with a natural-sounding human voice and smart glasses, raised a $250M Series B and opens an early beta of its iOS app (Sarah Perez/TechCrunch)
bullets: AI startup Sesame secured $250M in Series B funding.
Developing a natural-sounding AI agent & smart glasses.
An early beta of its iOS app is now available.
items.why_it_matters: Significant funding for AI innovation, potentially revolutionizing human-computer interaction through advanced conversational AI and wearable tech.

items.title: Japanese regulators' plan to cull the smallest listings on the Tokyo Stock Exchange is spurring a record number of startup buyouts in Japan, while IPOs slump (Bloomberg)
bullets: Japanese regulators plan to delist smallest companies from TSE.
This is causing a record number of startup buyouts in Japan.
Meanwhile, IPOs are experiencing a slump.
items.why_it_matters: Regulatory changes are reshaping Japan's startup ecosystem, favoring mergers and acquisitions over public offerings and impacting how new companies access capital.

items.title: A UN pact to fight cybercrime is set to be signed by dozens of countries in Hanoi; tech companies and activists warn the pact may criminalize ethical hacking (Francesco Guarascio/Reuters)
bullets: UN cybercrime pact to be signed by many countries in Hanoi.
Tech firms & activists fear it might criminalize ethical hacking.
The pact aims to be an unprecedented step against cybercrime.
items.why_it_matters: This global pact could significantly change cybercrime law, but concerns exist about its potential impact on cybersecurity research and human rights.

items.title: Hundreds of public figures sign a Future of Life Institute statement urging a ban on the development of AI superintelligence until it can be deployed safely (David Ingram/NBC News)
bullets: Public figures signed a Future of Life Institute statement.
They urge a ban on AI superintelligence development.
Ban proposed until safe deployment can be ensured.
items.why_it_matters: High-profile concerns about AI safety highlight a growing debate on responsible AI development and the potential risks of advanced artificial intelligence.

items.title: Palworld developer Pocketpair says its new publishing division won't fund games that use generative AI, saying it "doesn't believe" in the tech (Chris Kerr/Game Developer)
bullets: Palworld developer Pocketpair won't publish games using generative AI.
The company stated it "doesn't believe" in generative AI tech.
This stance applies to its new publishing division.
items.why_it_matters: A major game developer is taking a firm stance against generative AI in game creation, potentially influencing industry trends and content decisions.

items.title: Sources: Sequoia COO Sumaiya Balbale resigned after the firm refused to discipline partner Shaun Maguire over his comments calling Zohran Mamdani "an Islamist" (Financial Times)
bullets: Sequoia COO Sumaiya Balbale resigned.
Reason: firm didn't discipline partner Shaun Maguire.
Maguire made controversial comments about Zohran Mamdani.
items.why_it_matters: This highlights internal conflicts at a major venture capital firm over partner conduct and ethical standards, potentially impacting its reputation and internal culture.

items.title: Samsung says it is working on Android XR-based smart glasses in partnership with Warby Parker and Gentle Monster, during its Worlds Wide Open event (Sabrina Ortiz/ZDNET)
bullets: Samsung confirmed Android XR smart glasses.
Partnering with Warby Parker, Gentle Monster for design.
Teased during its Worlds Wide Open event.
items.why_it_matters: This marks Samsung's official entry into the smart glasses market, challenging competitors like Meta and Apple with a focus on fashion and the Android XR platform.

items.title: Samsung's Galaxy XR headset includes an Explorer Pack that bundles a year of Google AI Pro, YouTube Premium, Play Pass, and more with purchases through year-end (Matt Horne/Android Authority)
bullets: Galaxy XR includes an Explorer Pack for early buyers.
Bundle worth up to $1,000 with year-end purchase.
Perks: Google AI Pro, YouTube Premium, Play Pass, and more.
items.why_it_matters: This incentive aims to attract early adopters and boost sales for Samsung's new XR headset by offering significant value in bundled software and services.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy XR hands-on: micro-OLED displays are good, eye tracking works well, lighter than the Vision Pro, and Android XR looks a lot like Apple's visionOS (The Shortcut)
bullets: Hands-on: good micro-OLED displays & eye tracking.
Lighter design compared to Apple Vision Pro.
Android XR UI resembles Apple's visionOS.
Expected to be 50% cheaper than Vision Pro.
items.why_it_matters: Provides early user impressions, highlighting competitive advantages like comfort and price, and suggesting design similarities with a major rival in the XR space.
